intro: Secamone deflexa var. ankarensis, commonly known as the Ankarensis secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptic in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a prominent yellow corona. This species is often found in moist habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
